message.raw:
reverted the majority of the regression fix in commit: 58ad2e1ecf9c to fix further regressions introduced.

This regression fix appears to be mostly wrong. The static channel values stored in the HDF5 file were not quantised correctly.
This resulted in the static DDS channels being programmed with 0 amplitude and the frequency was out by a factor of 10.
The bug was actually introduced by incorrectly accessing the DDS sub-channel output values through the static_value parameter.
At the generate_code stage of the experiment, you should be accessing the raw_output array (as you cannot, by design, modify the contents of the static_value which is what you mean to do when you quantise the output)

Likely the original fix was introduced because of exceptions raised when compiling an experiment where a StaticDDS was not explictly commanded to set it's output. In such an instance it would fall back on the default value. The default value for Static(Analog/Digital)Quantities were not placed in the raw_output array correctly. This regression was fixed in a commit to the labscript repo: 7e50a2a0ce06

This regression fix appears to be mostly wrong. The static channel values stored in the HDF5 file were not quantised correctly.
This resulted in the static DDS channels being programmed with 0 amplitude and the frequency was out by a factor of 10.
The bug was actually introduced by incorrectly accessing the DDS sub-channel output values through the static_value parameter.
At the generate_code stage of the experiment, you should be accessing the raw_output array (as you cannot, by design, modify the contents of the static_value which is what you mean to do when you quantise the output)

Likely the original fix was introduced because of exceptions raised when compiling an experiment where a StaticDDS was not explictly commanded to set it's output. In such an instance it would fall back on the default value. The default value for Static(Analog/Digital)Quantities were not placed in the raw_output array correctly. This regression was fixed in a commit to the labscript repo: 7e50a2a0ce06
